Description: Glass flask; free-blown, gilded and enamelled; globular body, tall funnel neck and foot ring; the main area of the body is filled with birds amongst palmettes sketched in red enamel; the blue enamelled roundels around the base of the neck contain lions; short inscription in the lower register.
Curator's comments: The surface of this bottle was originally heavily gilded but most of this has disappeared.
Bibliographic references: Ward 2014 / Court and Craft: A Masterpiece from Northern Iraq (4)
Slade 1871 / Catalogue of the Collection of Glass formed by Felix Slade Esq, F S A. With Notes on the History of Glass Making by Alexander Nesbitt, Esq, F S A (334)
Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (172)
Lamm 1929-1930 / Mittelalterliche Gläser und Steinschnittarbeiten aus dem Nahen Osten (pl.180.3)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2015 – 2016 4 Dec – 29 May, National Museum of Singapore, ‘Treasures of the World’s Cultures’ 2014 20 Feb-18 May, London, Courtauld Gallery, 'Court and Craft in Medieval Mosul: A Masterpiece of Arab Metalwork' 2012 Nov Paris, Institut du Monde Arabe, 'Arabian Nights'
